snippet: A reader responds to a recent review of Philip Larkin’s “Complete Poems.”
lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Philip Larkin is the poet who ''did it'' for me: when I was 20, a wise teacher lent me her copy of the 1988 ''Collected Poems,'' and I haven't stopped reading poetry since. I must therefore admit some bias as I protest that Paul Muldoon is unfairly harsh when, in his otherwise illuminating assessment of the new ''Complete Poems'' (April 22), he dismisses the entirety of the ''poems not published in the poet's lifetime'' as ''hardly worth even a first look.''
